textList.name: TEXT_START_SCRAPPER
textList.text: Welcome to Scrapper space. The scrappers are elusive and don't make a habit of sharing information about their societies among travelers. They simply need scrap.

The Scrappers focus on acquiring scrap suggests that they prioritize resource acquisition above all else. Their societies are likely centered around scavenging, with social structures, customs, and hierarchies emerging from the need to efficiently collect and utilize resources. Cooperation and sharing of knowledge among Scrappers might occur within their own communities but may not extend readily to outsiders.

Scrappers seem to have a strong sense of self-reliance and resourcefulness, as they must navigate dangerous and unpredictable environments to find valuable scraps. They possess specialized knowledge about identifying and extracting useful materials from various sources, especially wrecked spacecraft and technological remnants.

event.name: GUARD_SCRAPPER_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Scrapper wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_SCRAPPER
event.text: It would appear that the Scrappers bothered to post a guard at this beacon. They are not hostile, nor are they readying weapons and indeed after a few moments of silence, they hail you. CAPTAIN! SURELY YOU WILL UNDERSTAND! A TOLL MUST BE COLLECTED! TRANSFER SCRAP OR NO ENTRY!
You alert your crew of defensive positions as the Guard powers up their weapons.
You peacefully transfer the scrap to the scrapper, allowing you entrance to the Scrappers Space.

choice.text: (Scrapper Crew) Your Scrapper insists on speaking to the Guard.

event.text: Unsure if this is a good idea, but trustful of your crew, you allow them to approach the comm. They animatedely shout at the guard, and with a few moments it seems that insults are being thrown. Insulted, the guard powers up weapons and begins to attack!

choice.text: (Trash Eater) The Trash Eater insists on speaking to the Guard.

event.text: The Trash Eater walks up to the Comm and announces his presence onboard the ship. The guard seems to be concerned, alarmed, and even frightened. The Trash Eater insists that they pay him for the right to guard the space and to allow us passage. They i agree, transfering supplies to your ship. The Trash Eater, pleased with himself, enjoys some of the scrap for himself.

event.name: SCRAPPER_GUARD_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Scrapper. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: SCRAPPER_GUARD_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Scrapper. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: SCRAPPER_GUARD_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Scrapper Guard, you've most certainly made your presence in this sector known They probably won't be so pleased with you after this.

choice.text: Do something onboard the ship first.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_SCRAPPER

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You warp in to find a rather strong looking Scrapper. They hail you, "YOU KILLED OUR GUARD!! WE WILL KILL YOU!!"

event.name: SCRAPPER_NON_SCRAPPER_HOSTILE_REBEL
event.text: You warp in to find a rebel ship waiting at the beacon for any of those foolish to warp to zero! It looks like thats you.

event.name: SCRAPPER_NON_SCRAPPER_HOSTILE_DESTROY
event.text: It would seem you are not the only visitor to Scrapper space. The foreign ship explodes, leaving behind a field of salvage for you to collect.

event.name: SCRAPPER_NON_SCRAPPER_HOSTILE_DEADCREW
event.text: It would seem you are not the only visitor to Scrapper space. The vessel lies empty, giving you plenty of time to salvage it.

event.name: SCRAPPER_BOARDED_SCRAPPER
event.text: You warp in to find a damaged Scrapper ship being boarded by a Mantis vessel.

choice.text: Attack the Mantis in an attempt to save the Scrapper!

event.text: This isn't your problem.

event.name: SCRAPPER_MANTIS_BOARDED_DESTROY
event.text: The Mantis ship has been destroyed, allowing you to salvage it and rescuing the assaulted Scrapper ship, who is hailing you.
"THANK YOU! YOU IMPRESS US! AMARA WISHES TO JOIN YOU!"
"YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!"
"THANK YOU AGAIN FOR THE RESCUE!!"

event.name: SCRAPPER_MANTIS_BOARDED_DEADCREW
event.text: The Mantis ship lies empty, allowing you to salvage it and rescuing the assaulted Scrapper ship, who is hailing you.
"THANK YOU! YOU IMPRESS US! AMARA WISHES TO JOIN YOU!"
"YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!"
"THANK YOU AGAIN FOR THE RESCUE!!"

textList.name: TEXT_SCRAPPER_HOSTILE
textList.text: A Scrapper vessel is in this sector salvaging the beacon. As soon as it notices you it powers up its weapons!
You warp in to find a scrapper vessel just as it finishes salvaging a wrecked ship; without warning it moves in to attack!
Some groups of Scrappers are very defensive of their territory and it seems as if you've impeded on this ones turf!
You enter the system and find an unusually aggressive Scrapper military vessel has locked onto your ship and is readying its weapons!
You find a Scrapper vessel closely orbiting the beacon, likely waiting for easy victims like you!

textList.name: TEXT_SCRAPPER_DESTROYED
textList.text: The Scrapper Ship breaks to pieces and you scrap whatever you can.
The Scrapper ship is no more. You scrap what you can.
The Scrappers are silent and their ship is in pieces, you scrap what remains.
The Scrapper wreckage lies scattered and smouldering. You salvage whatever fragments hold value.
Your crew salvages any usable remnants that remain from the the shattered Scrapper vessel.

textList.name: TEXT_SCRAPPER_DEADCREW
textList.text: The ship halls, now bloodied, are empty and silent. You take your time as you pick through the vessel.
The Scrappers put up a very tough fight but you are tougher.
The Scrappers have been killed Your crew strips the remainder of the Scrapper ship.
With the Scrappers defeated, your crew efficiently dismantles the remaining parts of their ship.
The lifeless bodies of the Scrappers mark their demise as your crew meticulously salvages the remaining Scrapper vessel.

You warp in to find an Elite Scrapper vessel just as it finishes salvaging a wrecked ship; without warning it moves in to attack!
You have warped in to find an Elite Scrapper vessel. It seems to simply dislike you as it powers up its weapons to engage.
You enter the system and find an unusually aggressive Scrapper military vessel has locked onto your ship and is readying its weapons!
You find a Scrapper vessel closely orbiting the beacon, likely waiting for easy victims like you!

event.name: SCRAPPER_ELITE_REWARD
event.text: You find an additional weapon and resources amongst the Elite Wreckage.

textList.name: AUTO_SCRAPPER_FIGHT
textList.text: The Scrappers love to hunt these Rebel Auto-Ships; it seems you and them have something in common.
The beacon flashes silently and the space seems clear, until an Auto-Ship makes itself known and readies weapons!
You warp in to the beacon only to be greeted by an Auto-Ship!
The Rebels and their massive fleet of Auto-Ships disgust you as you ready yourself for battle.

The Scrappers like to destroy Auto-Ships to salvage any valuable component they offer, they've even been known to hunt them in groups! The Auto-Ships still come around this space though, regardless of how many the Scrappers tear apart. Here's one now!

event.name: SCRAPPER_ENCOUNTER_SHOP
event.text: A scrapper vessel is in this sector. It's broadcasting a signal simply asking for scrap. Perhaps they mean to trade?
"EXCUSE ME?!? WE WILL STRIP THE SCRAP FROM YOUR BLOATED CARCASS!" It seems an advanced boarding party has entered your ship. Maybe they had a super shield bypass?

choice.text: Hail them and see if they would like to trade.

event.text: "WE NEED SCRAP!"
We don't need anything.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SHOP_DESTROY
event.text: You have destroyed the Scrapper vessel. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SHOP_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Scrapper. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SHOP_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Scrapper Shopkeeper, you've most certainly made yourself known to be an enemy of the Scrappers. They will resent you after this.

textList.name: TEXT_SCRAPPER_OUTPOST
textList.text: Despite the beacon warning visitors away, you warp in to find a Scrapper Outpost has been constructed in this sector. It appears to be well guarded, with a number of ships stationed throughout the system. The beacon seems to be hiding your presence for now, though, that won't last for long.

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

choice.text: Move in to engage the outpost!

event.text: As you move in to engage the outpost, you notice alarms break out and they ready themselves for battle.
Assuming this is a military facility, it would be heavily armed and very difficult to breach. It would be better to avoid conflict and leave the area.

choice.text: Attempt to sneak past the guards and ambush the station.
(Upgraded Cloak) Use your advanced cloaking device to sneak past the guards to get closer to the outpost undetected.

event.text: You successfully avoid the outer guards and approach the outpost directly. They have yet to detect you thanks to your cloak. You have a few moments before they detect you.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Send your crew directly on board the outpost to raid and steal anything they can!

event.text: You teleport your crew to the outpost and they get to work. Within a few moments you notice alert sirens all over the station; it would seem they were caught. "Success. Teleporter system damaged. Please rescue us." Within a moment you teleport them back to the bridge and ready for battle!

choice.text: No time to check the loot right now!

event.text: You catch the outpost off guard, allowing you to fully charge your weapons and attack them!
You manuever your ship through the system but shortly after you move away from the beacon you are immediately noticed!
You manage to sneak past the outer guards and into a close proximity with the station. They havent detected you, giving you the chance to charge your weapons.

event.name: SCRAPPER_OUTPOST_DESTROY
event.text: The outpost has been destroyed scattering the remainder of the guards. In the wreckage you find an advanced module, though, any valuable data that could have been retreived is destroyed.

choice.text: Investigate the module you have recovered.

event.name: SCRAPPER_OUTPOST_DEADCREW
event.text: The outpost goes silent, fearful of coming to the same fate, the remainder of the guards scatter. While scrapping the outpost for anything valuable you find a room of computers and download the data available to you. For some reason they contain fleet movement charts of the rebel fleet, allowing you to get an edge. You also find an advanced appearing module.

choice.text: Investigate the module you have recovered.

event.name: SCRAPPER_OUTPOST_REWARD
event.text: You have pulled an oddly advanced modification for your onboard crew lab from the outposts research labs. It seems to be an experiemental prototype.

choice.text: Install the module. [+10% to ALL crew stats.]

event.text: [Prototype Prismatic Crew Augmentors] Increases the following stats of all crew by 10%: Damage, Damage Taken, Health, Repair, Move, Sabotage and Heal Speed.]
The Augment has been installed.
You break the module down to valuable metals.
You break the module down to valuable metals.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SHIP_GRAVEYARD
event.text: You warp in to find a sprawling graveyard of ships, seemingly from a massive battle that took place an unknown time ago. You notice a number of unarmed scrapper ships roaming around the field picking at the scraps left behind. Not every vessel in the sector, however, is unarmed, as one such vessel approaches you and hails you.
"GREETINGS CAPTAIN!! BY RIGHT OF SALVAGE LAW THIS IS OUR BOUNTY AND ANY TRANSGRESSION WILL BE MET WITH AGRESSION!!"

choice.text: You want the salvage and propose a trade for access to the wreck. You explain the timeliness of your mission, and explain that you only wish to salvage a small portion of the wreckage for a fee.

event.text: "REASONABLE HUMAN CAPTAIN! TRADE ACCEPTED! SENDING TERMS!
You transmit the resources.

choice.text: Send your crew out to Salvage the wrecked ship you were given access to.

event.text: The salvaging team reports back and advises you that there is a large amount of scrap remaining onboard but it will take additional time to get everything. They send back a fair amount of resources and await your orders.

choice.text: Let's leave before the fleet catches up to us.

event.text: You leave before the fleet catches up.

choice.text: Order your team to spend more time salvaging.

event.text: The fleet catches up a bit more since you decided to spend additional time salvaging, but your team returns back with an even larger amount of resources from completely breaking down the ship, and an intact weapon pulled from the hull.

choice.text: A scrapper wishes to speak with you...

event.text: One of your crew still onboard your ship advises you that something is off about this ship graveyard. "THESE SHIPS ARE UNKNOWN TO ME! DESIGNS! STRANGE! NOT TYPICAL SCRAPPER SHIPS! WE SHOULD INVESTIGATE ANOTHER HULL!!" You are not unaware that your entrance fee only bought you allowance to one ship, that you've already salvaged.

choice.text: We should take the risk and investigate investigate another hull.

event.text: You order your crew to board another ship, one of the more unknown appearing hulls. The scrapper volunteers themselves to join as they are eager to investigate it themselves. Seemingly the Scrapper guards do not notice your crew boarding another ship.

choice.text: Give your crew some time to search the ship for anything notable.

event.text: Your crew report back that they have found a previously unseen augment that can be installed on to our ship! They also found some additional resources and have been teleported back safely. However, the Scrappers have caught wind of your actions, betrayed by your decision to scrap the 2nd derelict ship a guard has detached itself from the group and has begun persuing you.

choice.text: There is no Choice but to fight now.
We better not take the risk, some mysteries are better left unsolved.
Ignore the Scrapper and turn to leave.

event.text: The Scrapper Salvagers' Guard seem to acknowledge your lack of interest in the wreckage, and return to patrolling the area.

choice.text: It's better to not take any chances out here. Prepare to fight.

event.text: "HOW AWFUL!"

event.name: SCRAPPER_SALVAGE_GUARD_DESTROY
event.text: The guard has been destroyed. You should leave quickly before reinforcements come... Worse yet the the delay has allowed the fleet to catch up!

event.name: SCRAPPER_SALVAGE_GUARD_DEADCREW
event.text: The guards crew has been killed. You should leave quickly before reinforcements come... Worse yet the the delay has allowed the fleet to catch up!

event.name: SCRAPPER_SALVAGE_GUARD_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Scrapper Salvager, you've most certainly made your presence in this sector known. The Scrappers will probably remember this...

event.name: SCRAPPER_FREE_SCRAP
event.text: You find a derelict vessel floating nearby the beacon that you are able to quickly scrap down for resources.
You scrap down the wreckage.

event.name: SCRAPPER_FREE_STUFF
event.text: You find a derelict vessel floating nearby the beacon that you are able to quickly scrap down for resources.
You scrap down the wreckage.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SOLDIER_ESCAPE_POD
event.text: You detect what appears to be a small escape pod floating by near the beacon.

choice.text: Ignore the risk, someone could use help! Beam the escape pod directly aboard and open it!

event.text: Without a second thought your crew beams the pod aboard. Your crew opens it up and a Scrapper Soldier emerges from the pod. "THANK YOU! ESCAPED FROM EXPLODING SHIP! FLOATING FOR TOO LONG TO REMEMBER! WILL SERVE! CAN I HAVE SOME SCRAP?"

choice.text: Seems too easy but let's not look a gift horse in the mouth.

event.text: You have had bad run ins before with "escape pods" enough to know this is a bad idea.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_DEALER
event.text: "COME! COME!" A small scrapper ship is at this beacon, though, no advertisement was broadcast. "ARTIFACTS OF OLD! FOR A PRICE!! GIVE US SCRAP PLEASE WE ARE DESPERATE!" You notice that the Scrapper looks a bit worse for wear from the transmission.

choice.text: View what the Scrapper has for sale.

event.text: Through the transmission you see a table with a large amount of unrecognizable equipment and 'artifacts'; this seems more like a pawn shop or a yard sale, but nontheless you feel like you should help them out? They look like they're dying.
This is a scam. Artifacts are a scam.
"WHAT DID I EVER DO TO YOU!!??" The Scrapper cries. You mute the transmission.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_SCOUT_DESTROY
event.text: The ship explodes, vaporizing both the destitute scrapper and whatever they were trying to sell you.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_SCOUT_DEADCREW
event.text: With the death of the artifact dealer you feel a twinge of guilt for this senseless massacre of what you now realize to be an older scrapper, just trying to stay alive. Well with that nasty bit of business out of the way you send a team over to collect whatever it was they were trying to sell you and bring it back. After a few moments they return with scrap in hand as well as what appears to be an upgrade for your lab.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_CREW_SPEED
event.text:
"THANK YOU FOR YOUR PATRONAGE! I THINK I WILL BE ABLE TO SURVIVE A LITTLE BIT LONGER NOW!!"
[Installed Artifact Effect: All Crew Move Speed, Repair Speed and Sabotage Speed +5%]

choice.text: Ask the Scrapper if they would like help... they seem to be in a bit of a desperate situation.

event.text: "OH! CAN YOU?!" They scream into the comm. "THIS SHIP DOESN'T WORK! ENGINES COMPLETELY BROKEN! COMRADES DEAD FOR MUCH TIME! CAN I COME ABOARD?! I AM VERY SKILLED AT SHIP OPERATIONS!!"
"OKAY! THANK YOU!!" You may never really get used to how loud Scrappers are.
"OKAY! THANK YOU FOR YOUR SCRAP!"

choice.text: Thank the Scrapper and be on your way.

event.text: "OKAY! THANK YOU FOR YOUR SCRAP!"

event.text:
Your crew bring you a particularly advanced module that seems compatible with your med lab that you install immediately.
[Installed Artifact Effect: All Crew Move Speed, Repair Speed and Sabotage Speed +5%]

event.name: SCRAPPER_CONTAINER
event.text: You warp in to find a drifting container marked with Scrapper paint and oddly grafted metal jutting from it. It appears to be a lost shipping container.

Your rock crew successfully smashes open the container. Inside appears to be a large amount of consumer goods that your crew is able to salvage for scrap, as well as what appears to be a weapon that was being smuggled. It's yours now.

Your rock crew successfully smashes open the container. Inside appears to be a large amount of consumer goods that your crew is able to salvage for scrap, as well as what appears to be a weapon that was being smuggled. It's yours now.

choice.text: (Elite Scrapper Crew) Expertly salvage the container.

event.text: Your elite scrappers make quick work of the scrapper container. Inside appears to be a large amount of consumer goods that your crew is able to salvage for scrap, as well as what appears to be a weapon that was being smuggled. It's yours now.

Your upgraded weapons make short work of the containers outer shielding, but it seems it was too effective, and everything inside has been completely destroyed. Well, at least its still viable metal that you can scrap, right?
It's better to not risk anything and allow the container to continue drifting through space.

No matter how much your crew tries, the containers door won't budge. Even worse, a Scrapper vessel has warped in seemingly to recover the container and notice you messing with it! They move in to attack!

Your crew manages to pry the container open. Inside appears to be a large amount of consumer goods that your crew is able to salvage for scrap, as well as what appears to be a weapon that was being smuggled. It's yours now.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ENCOUNTER_ASTEROID
event.text: A Scrapper ship is in the system salvaging asteroids. They notice you and power up their weapons.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ENCOUNTER_SUN
event.text: A Scrapper ship in the system hails you, "HOT! FIRE! HOT HOT HOT! TAMALE HOT!" Before you can parse meaning from this, it powers its weapons.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ENCOUNTER_STORM
event.text: A Scrapper ship has come to this system seeking easy victims in the storm.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER
event.text: You warp in to find a Scrapper vessel advertising the sell of a number of slaves they have in their posession. Scrapper society is largely factionalized, leaving gaps in the protections of individuals like these. YOU THERE! FINE WORKERS FOR YOUR SHIP! SMALL PRICE TO PAY FOR THE BEST!

choice.text: Thank the slavers and be on your way.
Thank the slavers and be on your way.

event.text: You attack the slavers.
You'd rather not participate in this business.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_DESTROY
event.text: The Slavers' ship explodes, vaporizing the slaves inside. Liberating them from their chains in one sense, at least.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_DEADCREW
event.text: The Slavers ship lies empty, allowing you to rescue the imprisoned crew. You promise to drop them off at the next space station. One of them offers to join your crew. "GOOD! HELLO! THANK YOU FOR RESCUE! NASTY BUSINESS! I HOPE I NEVER SEE THESE CLOWNS AGAIN!"

choice.text: Decline the Scrappers offer, and insist you drop them off.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_FOLLOWUP
event.text: The slaver ship seems to have sent out a broadcast to it's comrades. This probably isn't the last time you've seen them.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_SCRAPPER_SLAVER
event.text: You find yourself sitting at the beacon for a few moments, staring out at space, just taking in the beauty.

While admiring the stars and the infinite void, a scrapper vessel enters the system and hails you, its weapons powering up. "YOU MESSED WITH WRONG SCRAPPERS!" It seems that the slavers have found you.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_FOLLOWUP_DESTROY
event.text: The Slaver's second ship explodes, vaporizing any surviving slaves on-board. You recover a computer terminal from the wreckage that you can peruse for information.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_FOLLOWUP_DEADCREW
event.text: The Slavers ship lies empty, allowing you to rescue an imprisoned crew member that was forced to work on the ship. "Hello. Thank you for rescuing me." The large scrapper is different than any of the other scrappers you have come across before; this one is quieter... "I am still chained, but I can be of service on-board your ship if you'd allow me; it seems my only purpose is to work..."

choice.text: Decline the Scrappers offer, and insist you drop them off at the nearest starbase.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_SECOND_FOLLOWUP
event.text: The terminal contains a large amount of information, including information about the local sector, and charts detailing the rebels movements. Upon further investigation you find what appears to be the location of an outpost belonging to the slavers. You could put a stop to their slave trade.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_OUTPOST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is where the slaver outpost is.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You have found the location of the slaver outpost. The beacon obscures the stations sensors for the time being.

choice.text: (Advanced Cloak) Sneak closer to the Outpost to gain a strategic advantage.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_OUTPOST_DESTROY
event.text: The Outpost explodes, vaporizing any slaves that may have been onboard. Your crew makes quick work of the salvage.
"My sibling... I wish you would not have done that, captain. I will see myself off of this ship at the next opportunity. Thank you."

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_OUTPOST_DEADCREW
event.text: The Slaver's outpost lies empty. Your crew finds and rescues a large number of slaves kept here to be sold off into slavery. The ship will be a bit crowded for a bit, until you can get to a federation station to drop them off at...

"Sibling." They say, approaching one of the Scrapper slaves coming aboard the ship. They come up to one another and embrace one another. This Scrapper seems to have undergone the same augmentations as Ariaso. They respond in a similarly demure manner. "Did not think I would see you again... These traitors... Could never break me." Their embrace lasts quite a while, and at last they turn to you. "I wish to come aboard with my sibling."
"Thank you for this, captain." Ariaso seems very grateful for your actions here...

choice.text: Continue on to strip the outpost of anything valuable and interesting.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_OUTPOST_SIBLINGS_FOLLOWUP
event.text: Ariaso approaches you. "Thank you for saving my sibling. I wish I could repay you in some way other than with my loyalty and my service to your ship." Variasa approaches you as well. "Perhaps I could offer something? While serving aboard the outpost, I secretely gained access to the slavers databases and managed to find coordinates that lead to the home base of the Slaver Faction. Their leader operates out of a station there. Slaying them could scatter the faction and cease slaver activities for quite some time." And not to mention the countless slaves that would be spared from such a horrible fate...

choice.text: Take the coordinates and prepare to warp directly to the slavers territory. First, you must finish salvaging the outpost.
Take the coordinates for later and finish scrapping the station.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SLAVER_OUTPOST_EXTRA_REWARD
event.text: Your crew find a treasure trove of valuable electronics and resources. They also pull a highly advanced crew upgrade for your ship from the wreckage that you can install to your onboard lab.

[Prototype Personnal Power Augmentors] Converts a small(2%) percentage of crews health and movement speed for the capacity to generate power for the room they're working in. Does not affect crew who cannot man systems or crew that already have the ability to manipulate power systems.

choice.text: Scrap down the module and carry on.

event.text: [Prototype Personnal Power Augmentors] Converts a small(2%) percentage of crews health and movement speed for the capacity to generate power for the room they're working in. Does not affect crew who cannot man systems or crew that already have the ability to manipulate power systems.

choice.text: Install the upgrade and carry on to Slaver's Territory.
Scrap down the module and carry on to the Slaver's Territory.

event.name: START_SCRAPPER_SLAVER
event.text: You have entered The Chains' territory. There is no guard stationed here to deal with. It would seem that this sector is blanketed in a thick nebula that leaves your sensor blind. A perfect place to hide a shadowy business enterprise.

choice.text: The Scrapper Siblings approach the comm...

event.text: "This is where The Chain hides." "A cowards place to die." "Find them and kill them." "Their station must not be destroyed." "We must confront The Chain directly." "The Captain musn't die." "Lead us there so that we may return to our prior form." The siblings spoke in tandem, alternating between their lines as if they were in each others minds. They have grown closer to one another...physically closer. Since entering the sector, they have seemingly become magnetically attached to one another.

textList.name: HOSTILE_SCRAPPER_SLAVER_TEXT
textList.text: You enter the system to find a Scrapper Slaver hiding in the clouds. "FOUND YOU! STOP YOU!" They power weapons!
The clouds of the nebula keep all signs of activity hidden from the outside. You find an obscurred Scrapper Slaver hiding amongst the clouds. Prepare for combat!

"THE CHAIN WILL NOT BE QUESTIONED! THE CHAIN WILL NOT BE DEFEATED! THE CHAIN IS ABOVE ALL!" There is a broadcast emanating from the clouds, it would seem someone is putting on a rock show for The Chain. You interrupt the gathering.
Deep within the nebula, it seems, Scrappers are hidden almost everywhere. They activate their weapons, prepared for a fight!
Within the nebula, lies a den of Salvage Scoundrels. One of them breaks off from the group and powers weapons. Prepare yourself for the impending battle!

choice.text: Send your Scrapper out to check the wreckage.

event.text: Your Scrapper takes a closer look into the computer systems of the vessel and retreived map data for the sector.
Your Scrapper looks around the Scrapper vessel but were unable to find anything more of value.
Your Scrapper finds a locked cache that your crew missed and opens it, finding a weapon that the slavers were smuggling.
